snippet: As American regulators aim for a harder line on big banks, a newspaper in Ireland says audiotapes prove that bankers were lying during the 2008 crisis.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column examines revelation of audiotapes showing that Anglo Irish Bank lied to officials about its finances in order to secure bailout in 2008; holds bank's malfeasance eventually cost European Union and Irish taxpayers tens of billions of euros, setting unfortunate precedent and laying course for austerity measures that continue to hobble country's economy.
lead_paragraph: As American regulators aim for a harder line on big banks, a newspaper in Ireland says audiotapes prove that bankers were lying during the 2008 crisis.

headline.print_headline: In Ireland, Dire Echoes Of a Bailout Gone Awry
headline.main: In Ireland, Dire Echoes of a Bailout Gone Awry
